# Network endpoints requirements for Appdome

Last updated July 17, 2025 by Appdome

Most organizations restrict network communication to the Internet by using a firewall/proxy solution. To enable this solution, you need to make sure that the outgoing and incoming communication to the required service endpoints is allowed. Allowing the communication is necessary in order to enable connection to the Appdome platform within the corporate network.

This page lists IP addresses and port settings needed for Firewall/proxy settings to be able to connect to Appdome.

|  |  |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| **Used for** | **Hostname (IP address/subnet)** | **Protocol** | **Port** |
| Accessing Appdome API | apis.appdome.com | HTTPS | 443 |
| Submitting support request/ Knowledge base | support.appdome.com | HTTPS | 443 |
| Uploading and securing mobile applications | fusion.appdome.com | HTTPS | 443 |
| Main Appdome Site | https://www.appdome.com | HTTP/HTTPS | 443/80 |
| Used to upload and downloading binary files | s3.us-west-1.amazonaws.com | HTTPS | 443 |
